thread.title: 7 things to know about today, plus Disney's Star Wars, Toy Story and Pandora plans
thread.title_full: 7 things to know about today, plus Disney's Star Wars, Toy Story and Pandora plans

author: Cindy Barth
title: 7 things to know about today, plus Disney's Star Wars, Toy Story and Pandora plans
text: 7 things to know about today, plus Disney's Star Wars, Toy Story and Pandora plans Aug 17, 2015, 7:03am EDT Industries & Tags Cindy Barth Editor Orlando Business Journal Home of the Day PR NEWSWIRE Avatar Flight of Passage at Disney's Animal Kingdom allows guests to soar on a Banshee… more As you probably already know, The Walt Disney Co. made a series of huge announcements on Saturday at the D23 EXPO regarding new themed lands coming to several of its Orlando-area theme parks. Here's a quick rundown of what's planned: Star Wars-themed lands are coming to Disney's Hollywood Studios in Orlando and Disneyland park in Anaheim, Calif. Each 14-acre land will transport guests to a never-before-seen planet with two signature attractions, including a customized secret mission on the Millennium Falcon and a Star Wars adventure that puts guests in the middle of a climactic battle. Other additions include: Star Tours – The Adventures Continue : Later this year, Star Tours will include a new adventure featuring locations and characters from the upcoming film, Star Wars: The Force Awakens . Star Wars Launch Bay : This interactive experience will take guests into the upcoming film, Star Wars: The Force Awakens , with special exhibits and peeks behind-the-scenes, including opportunities to visit with new and favorite Star Wars characters, special merchandise and food offerings. Jedi Training Academy: A favorite of younger fans is being re-imagined with a new experience that includes new characters and a new villain to battle from the popular Disney XD series Star Wars Rebel s. Season of the Force : This new seasonal event, beginning in early 2016, brings new experiences to both coasts. At Disney's Hollywood Studios, guests will close out weekend nights with a new fireworks set to the iconic score of the Star Wars movies. The new 11-acre Toy Story Land will transport guests into Andy's backyard, where you will think you've been shrunk to the size of Woody and Buzz surrounded by oversized toys that Andy has assembled. Toy Story Land also will include: Family-friendly roller coaster. All on the back of Slinky Dog, this coaster will zip and zoom, plunge and coast as it takes guests on a fun, toy-filled adventure throughout the new land. Alien saucers attraction : The famous little green aliens from the movie will take guests around for a spin in their very own flying saucers. The music, lighting and sound effects add to the flurry of action, while "The Claw" looms over. Toy Story Mania! : Guests glide into the Toy Story Midway Games Play Set and take aim at 3D objects in a variety of fast-paced games, with an expansion that adds a third track to this popular attraction. As part of the largest expansion in the park's history, Disney's Animal Kingdom will immerse guests into the world of Pandora, and the entire park will transform after dark with new nighttime entertainment experiences, including: Rivers of Light : Expected to open next spring, Rivers of Light will combine live music, floating lanterns, water screens and swirling animal imagery. Kilimanjaro Safaris : This popular attraction will be extended for a new nighttime adventure next spring. Pandora – The World of Avatar: Disney's Animal Kingdom guests will journey into the world of Pandora that includes floating mountains, a bioluminescent forest and the winged creatures known as Banshees. Meanwhile, the Avatar Flight of Passage allows guests to soar on a Banshee over an alien world. And be sure to check out these other Monday headlines: Harris Corp.'s suggested tax break: $918,819 It will be interesting to see if this one makes it through the approval process. OK, so it likely will considering the fact that Harris Corp. agreed to keep its headquarters in Melbourne rather than move out of the area after its acquisition of McLean, Va.-based Exelis earlier this year. An advisory board is recommending that Harris Corp. get $918,819 in property tax breaks over nine years, Florida Today reports . Apparently, incentives were one of the company's deciding factors in staying in Florida. How many others were offered? That's unknown at this point. So you think you could work at Amazon? Read this fascinating New York Times' story about what it's like to work for Amazon and ask yourself a question: Would you work there? ( Here are Amazon's 14 "leadership principals." ) Money quote from one former employee: “I was so addicted to wanting to be successful there ... it was like a drug that we could get self-worth from.” GreenPointe building new condos in Daytona Beach Shores GreenPointe Communities LLC plans to build a new oceanfront development in Daytona Beach Shores called The Aruba Condominium. The 12-story Aruba Condominium will be located on South Atlantic Avenue, a half-mile south of the Port Orange Causeway. Floor plans will range from 1,400 square feet to more than 1,800 square feet, with homes priced from the $300,000s. Verizon invests $135M on Florida network in first-half of 2015 Verizon Wireless has invested $135 million in network enhancements in Florida during the first half of 2015, highlighted by the expansion of its XLTE technology to boost 4G LTE coverage and services for customers throughout the state. More than 230 new Verizon XLTE sites have been activated so far this year across Florida. Verizon engineers also have completed new large-scale 4G LTE in-building and venue systems at dozens of high-traffic sites such as hospitals, hotels, government buildings and more in recent months.
